skill.name: x-article-publisher
skill.description: Publish Markdown articles to X (Twitter) Articles editor with proper formatting. Use when user wants to publish a Markdown file/URL to X Articles, or mentions "publish to X", "post article to Twitter", "X article", or wants help with X Premium article publishing. Handles cover image upload and converts Markdown to rich text automatically.
skill.summary: Publish Markdown articles to X (Twitter) Articles editor with proper formatting. Use when user wants...
skill.author: wshuyi

security_audit.summary: Legitimate article publishing skill with standard Python scripts. Processes user-specified files only. No network calls, no credential access, no code execution vulnerabilities. Uses macOS clipboard APIs and image processing libraries as expected for clipboard operations.

low_findings.title: macOS clipboard access via AppKit
low_findings.description: The copy_to_clipboard.py script uses macOS AppKit APIs (NSPasteboard, NSData) to copy images and HTML to the system clipboard. This is necessary for the stated purpose of pasting rich content into the X Articles editor. An attacker could potentially misuse clipboard access, but this capability is explicitly required for the skill's functionality.

content.value_statement: Converting Markdown articles for X (Twitter) Articles takes time and attention to formatting. This skill automates the conversion process, preserving headers, links, lists, and images while positioning them correctly in the editor.
actual_capabilities: Parse Markdown files and extract title, images, and structured content
Convert Markdown to HTML for rich text pasting
Copy images and HTML to system clipboard
Position images at precise block indices in the editor
Handle cover image upload separately from content images
Support headers, links, lists, blockquotes, and bold text
limitations: Requires X Premium Plus subscription for Articles feature
Works only on macOS with Playwright MCP installed
Manual verification required before final publishing
Does not support inline images within paragraphs

use_cases.title: Publish blog posts to X
use_cases.description: Convert existing Markdown blog posts and publish them as X Articles with proper formatting and images.

use_cases.title: Share documentation articles
use_cases.description: Transform technical documentation written in Markdown into polished X Articles with code blocks and images.

use_cases.title: Cross-post newsletter content
use_cases.description: Take Markdown newsletter content and publish to X to reach a broader audience on the platform.

prompt_templates.title: Basic article publish
prompt_templates.prompt: Publish my article at /path/to/article.md to X Articles

prompt_templates.title: Article with images
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me publish this Markdown file with images to X Articles: ~/blog/my-post.md

prompt_templates.title: Draft verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Parse my article and create a draft in X Articles. I will review before publishing.

prompt_templates.title: Batch workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Publish this article using the efficiency guidelines. Parse first, prepare HTML, then handle images in reverse block order.

output_examples.input: Publish my article at ~/docs/tutorial.md to X Articles
output: Images processed content: 5 images + 1 cover image

best_practices: Parse Markdown first to get structured data before starting browser automation
Insert images in reverse block order to avoid position shifts
Always save as draft and verify formatting before publishing
Use block indices instead of text matching for reliable image positioning
anti_patterns: Do not auto-publish without user verification
Avoid waiting for elements that only appear after clicking create
Do not use browser_wait_for for simple element detection
Avoid text matching for image positioning when block indices are available

faq.question: What X subscription do I need?
faq.answer: X Articles requires X Premium Plus subscription. Verify your account has access before using this skill.

faq.question: What image formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports JPG, PNG, GIF, and WebP images. Images are compressed to reduce upload time.

faq.question: Can I use this on Windows or Linux?
faq.answer: No. The clipboard functionality uses macOS-specific AppKit APIs. Browser automation requires Playwright MCP.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. Files are processed locally. The skill only accesses files you explicitly specify and never sends data to external servers.

faq.question: Why are my images out of order?
faq.answer: Insert images in reverse block order (highest block_index first). Each image insertion shifts subsequent positions.

faq.question: How is this different from manual publishing?
faq.answer: The skill automates conversion, clipboard operations, and image positioning. You still verify and click publish manually.
